content:
Hi all, <@360491619402776577> has been helping us on some hive updates to the "Invalid Ancestor" tests in this PR:
https://github.com/ethereum/hive/pull/560
Basically all tests would now get the invalid payload retrieved from p2p via Sync, and ~~most of the clients are failing the tests again~~ some tests are failing again, but we think these are genuine new issues, so I wanted to share the results of running these changes before committing them.
You can see the logs here: https://github.com/ethereum/hive/pull/560#issuecomment-1184730752

content: Did <@425572898787426305> verify the changes as well?  He was the one bringing up the attack vector, so I would like to make sure that the tests still cover that.

author: marioevz
content: In my opinion this implementation is more in line with the original idea of the attack scenario, the newPayload implementation was a workaround because we could not deliver invalid blocks via sync, but Marius wrote a node that now delivers them via p2p.
